website_summaries.verdict: This premium backpacking chair is durable, lightweight, and easy to set up.
pros: Capable of supporting up to 350 lbs
Aluminum frame is rustproof and offers outstanding strength
Chair won't sink in sand or mud
Weighs only 2 lbs., ensuring you should have no trouble carrying the chair with you at your convenience
Sold in a variety of attractive colors
cons: Tends to wear down and break easily
Chair fabric may be tough to keep on the frame

customer_reviews.title: All-Terrain Piece of Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed!! The elastic broke during the FIRST disassembly. It did not make it out of my kitchen let alone outside in the back country. Nothing suggests this is an ‘all-terrain chair’. Made in China is right... 0 out of 4 stars! UPDATE: On behalf of the seller, they did contact me right away and offer to replace the chair or a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: hexacat

customer_reviews.title: Solid build
customer_reviews.text: This chair is solidly built, and the included feet help keeps it from sinking in sand or gravel. It is fairly lightweight and felt GREAT to sit on when I took it with me backpacking the backcountry wilderness. The flexibility of the poles allowed me to slightly rock back and forth in the chair without worrying that it would break. Money well spent. [EDIT 4/9/2018: After having used this chair for a few times, my biggest complaint is that the interchangeable feet often are DIFFICULT to remove, particularly after a heavier person (like my grandpa) has sat on it.] If you found this review helpful, please hit the "Yes" button to encourage me to write more. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Photographer | Tech Pro | Outdoor EnthusiastTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Chair topples backwards easily!
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed very flimsy. I bought it for my mother in law to replace an old beach chair she used for reading out in her patio. When she sat on it, she almost toppled backwards. It did not support her well. My husband sat on it and he almost toppled backwards. It supported me better, (I weigh 140 pounds) however, I sunk deeply in and it didn't feel roomy. The chair easily toppled backwards if you lean. I liked the color and the exchangeable feet, however, the feet did slip off too easily and fell out when I lifted the chair off the ground. I believe they would be easy to misplace.
customer_reviews.author: C Blalock

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Light. Poor Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and light weight. The round extra feet are well worth the extra money because you are not sinking in to the ground when its soft EDIT: After using this chair a few times, it broke when I sat down. It just snapped and I only weigh 130lb.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki B.

customer_reviews.title: Good chair and works nice for a bigger guy like myself
customer_reviews.text: What a great chair! I'm a bigger guy at 240 lbs or so currently, this held me up no problem. It does have some 'flex' to it by design, but nothing that feels like it's going to shatter under me. Also, I was prepared for a difficult assembly, but it went together nice. You do have to stretch the cloth a bit to get the last leg in but not too hard, they also have finger loops for you to use to pull the pocket over the leg. Hopefully this will hold up well over time, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Crookedsky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfortable, Compact
customer_reviews.text: This chair is awesome! It sets up quickly and easily, and packs up nice and small. It's perfect for tossing in your trunk and keeping there for watching your kids' soccer games or sitting next to the fire. I've bought a few of them now and keep a couple in my camping bins and trunk. The construction is sturdy and they look great. I'm kinda shocked at how sturdy they are despite their size and weight. You'll for sure be happy with this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Geertsen

customer_reviews.title: i LOVE this chair
customer_reviews.text: I always loved bringing my hammock when we go out rock climbing however.... hammocks are harder to put up/take down/move around and there arent always trees right near the crag. This little baby weighs the same as my hammock (isnt quite as comfortable of course because its a chair so you cant lay down and take a nap) but its perfect because i can pop a squat right next to the rock face and move it down a few feet or to the next crag without taking it all apart. Its so light i just flip it over my head as we move to the next crag. 10/10 would recommend haha
customer_reviews.author: Alexis G

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It takes a minute or 2 max to set up but it is very comfortable, lightweight and folds up to fit in your beach bag/backpack. Love it. While everyone else is carrying around those fold up chairs on shoulder, mine is conveniently hidden and such a breeze to carry. Estimate less than 2lbs as I can pick it up fully assembled with thumb and forefinger alone. I can also sit in this for a long while at the beach with no circulation issues or poking from frame like the folding chairs you buy at grocery stores/Wal-Mart.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding All-Around Camp and Outdoor Events Chair
customer_reviews.text: There are a million similar style camp chairs on the market, but after a lot of research I settled on the Terralite due to good reviews, but primarily because of the large Terragrip ball feet to address the weakness many chairs in this category experience with sinking into soft surfaces. I've used it now for a few months and can report I am very happy with the chair overall. The chair is sturdy, comfortable and easy to assembly and take down. The ball feel were especially great for using the chair on a grass surface watching fireworks. I also like that the ball feet can be removed and exchanged with standard feet based on ground conditions. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Huancayo

customer_reviews.title: Serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, both failed by the third use. One of them failed on the first use. The chairs are comfortable and the alternative leg adapters for sand are very handy. The problem is that the end caps that secure the shock cords frequently get caught on the removable footpads or on the cloth seat material. This happened on both chairs that were purchased months apart. On one chair the end caps are permanently stuck inside the ‘removable’ feet - rendering them now nonremovable. The other one suffered broken shock cords when trying to remove the feet. If you never disassemble the chair, I assume it would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mama k

customer_reviews.title: Great for anything
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing, I decided to purchase another one because my first one worked so well. I use them for camping and on our boat. They are compact to store and transport anywhere. These are a little more expensive than other comparable Amazon items, but, the difference is the wide feet. However, when you compare these to more expensive units found at REI, these are a great buy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mike gholson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst chair ever. Bought this for my husband as a birthday gift. It broke right away. He’s well under the weight limit. We figured it was a fluke, since it’s was moderately expensive. The company sent a new one out. That one broke in the same place instantly. Pissed, we messaged the company, they sent out yet another. It broke within days. Same place. Now we have 3 useless, unfixable chairs. At this point I just want my money back. I wish they would solve the problem in the design instead of sending out more crap.
customer_reviews.author: SuperCoolArtTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, compact and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are well-built and comfortable. I love how light they are and would even consider backpacking with them if they weren't quite as bulky. The come with standard feet (small rubber covers) installed on the legs. They also come with large, round feet (about the size of a racquet ball cut in half) that can be installed to prevent sinking into soft soil. These are FANTASTIC! I installed mine and used them on rain-soaked ground that was just barely dried out on the surface. No sinking at all. They also handle slightly uneven ground very well. I bought two and wouldn't hesitate to buy more if I needed them. Great product and great value!
customer_reviews.author: G. McDuffie

customer_reviews.title: Best Chair Of This Type Available.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is the best available and one of the least expensive. I have looked at many versions/brands at REI. Very sturdy (I'm 5'10" and 195 pounds), comfortable, a little taller than typical, 2.07 pounds without the bag or big feet, some flex allows you to rock back and forth a little with chair legs still on the ground, easy to get out of (you can push yourself up using hands on both sides of fabric), good customer service. I bought two chairs and one was missing a rubber foot. I contacted the supplier and they immediately sent a bag of four for good measure. Obviously very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HornyToad

customer_reviews.title: Chair is very comfortable and great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Chair is very comfortable and great for the money, but the feet that come on the legs need to fit tighter. I saw many reviews that stated the same thing. The sand feet fit tight and stay on but the regular ones fall off constantly. I wrapped gorilla tape around the legs and this worked great for them, but it makes the sand feet hard to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Tater

customer_reviews.title: The feet make all the difference!
customer_reviews.text: My buddies were sinking in the mud and looking for rocks to put under the feet of their chairs. I sat down by the fire and watched it all happen, never worried about sinking into the mud. I would have liked them to be a little lighter, but they are not heavy. Great addition to my backpacking kit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this specifically to take to Waikiki where the beach chairs can cost upwards of $35 per day to rent and can only be used where the rental company places them. The Terralite is lightweight, sturdy, packs easily in our luggage and is easy to set up. Plus, we can take it with us to other locations around thr Island where rental beach chairs are not available. The wide rubber feet work well on sand to prevent the chair from digging in. I have also used the chair on the mainland for fishing and camping. Want to buy a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: 3BGBB

customer_reviews.title: comfortably with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the chair last year and just used it in Hawaii on the beach and on grass. I weigh 240lbs and had issues with the cheap canvas chairs since they only support 150lbs. We travel every year to Hawaii and purchase chairs there and leave them or they break. Because of this chairs lite weight we took it with us in our luggage. For 3 weeks it supported me on uneven sand and grass, comfortably with no issues. It should last for years and was a good solution over the disposable chairs. I did not even have to use the wider feet supplied. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PJJ

customer_reviews.title: Last minute buy for a trip to the desert
customer_reviews.text: Really needed a light frame, portable, COMFORTABLE chair for a trip to Northern Africa so I did my research and bought this...one of my best purchases yet. EASY to put together. LOTS of room to sit and relax. The ball supports that you get for the ends of the feet were a BRILLIANT extra, especially for sitting in the sand...you don’t sink in. Plus, it was compact and lightweight to fit in my bag easily. If you want a portable camp chair and can’t afford the big name fancy ones, get this!
customer_reviews.author: L Laksbergs

customer_reviews.title: Loved the seat, but not very longlasting.
customer_reviews.text: My husband chose this chair to replace his large bulky one. He used it several times while camping, over landing, hiking & for family park outings. Tonight while using it as a temporary seat in our living room, as we have just moved cross country & don't have furniture, the leg post popped through the seat corner pocket. He weighs about 225 lbs so that shouldn't have been an issue. Quite disappointing that the chair made it barely 7 months before failing. Wish we could replace it, but most likely would only get another short time from the replacement. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Masnick Clan

customer_reviews.title: Great little, lite chair fits tall folks
customer_reviews.text: I am 6’2” 225lbs. I wanted a chair i could carry for events (concerts, fireworks, picnics) which is lite, compact and durable. I have used it twice and it is lite, compact, easy to set up (except the seat if you are weak upperbody challenged). I imagine it can be slightly challenging to fit the seat covers over the posts if you have arm, shoulder, hand issues) but i could do it easy enough—just a warning for those looking for very easy assembly. I am pleased with the purchase, only complaint is I would prefer less vibrant colors-how about “camo”?
customer_reviews.author: Snotter

customer_reviews.title: They were so close to being so good...then they broke.
customer_reviews.text: They come with changeable feet- 1 set which is great for normal dirt,concrete, etc, and another which are large, textured, grippy feet perfect for ice, uneven surfaces, etc. The chairs feel great, sit great, and look good too. After the first weekend of use, we started packing up camp and the very first foot I pulled off snapped. I wouldn’t have truly cared, however the frame is attached with an elastic cord inside which broke when the foot came off. I’m returning both, and hopefully they can recommend another chair they make with a similar weight capacity that will not break so easily. I would gladly give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Love these camping chairs! Perfect to keep in car!
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the red and green ones. They both fit perfectly in my cargo net in the back of my car with plenty of room to spare! I weigh 325 Lbs, so I was originally a little cautious when sitting on these, but it's gained my trust and can comfortably plop down knowing I'll be supported with every seat I take! 100% would recommend! If I ever need more than 2, I'll for sure buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put together
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning as I never could get all four corners onto poles. I watched the video review that was helpful and saw my methodology was correct, but I do need a chair I can actually put together by myself without injuring myself in the process. 3 stars as the material seemed good and good chance I had a fluke chair. Edit: after buying the name brand chair this chair is only worth two stars. I spent two days trying to put together but got my other helinox chair together in seconds. Definitely was the chair that was the problem
customer_reviews.author: Brynn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Even after reading the description I was surprised by how light the chair is. And yet despite the light weight, it feels substantial. It would be nice if the back came up a little bit higher, but this thing beats the heck out of sitting on a log or in the dirt! Highly recommend it. Just be sure you set it up right away and let the back stretch or your first foray into the great outdoors will be spoiled by having to try to stretch this thing to fit. Better to get that out of the way at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking / unless you're the ultralight type of backpacker
customer_reviews.text: When backpacking, there are some luxuries you cant live without, even when backpacking light. For me, its something comfortable to sit on in camp. I know many backpackers use an egg carton-type pad or sit on their bear canisters. I choose to take the extra weight and be comfortable. The chair is about 3 lbs and for me, its well worth it. I thought it might be easily broken but it is quite sturdy. I weigh 195 lbs, and it never stressed about the weight.
customer_reviews.author: R. Keener

customer_reviews.title: Almost a great chair.
customer_reviews.text: This chair has some things going for it- it's lightweight, compact, and holds a decent sized person. There are two things which are hard to look past, however. It is very difficult to slide the seat onto the frame. I struggle with it, and my wife is completely unable to do it, so keep in mind that you aren't going to have your child do it on their own, even if otherwise, the assembly is straight forward. The second thing is that I developed a tear on the seat already, so it's making me question the longevity of the item.
customer_reviews.author: GoingFar

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have for Camping or Glamping
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these chairs and really love them. They fold up into a small case, about 15" long and 6" around. The small foot bobs come off and you just snap on the larger feet. Even though we have a large camping rug, these feet work great so you don't puncture the rug. Assembly is easy - each section is attached by an elastic cord which you just extend out for the frame. THe seat then slips over the 4 prongs. One thing to be careful of -- do not sit on the front edge or you will tip. I leaned forward to pet the dogs and it tumbled me. Otherwise very strudy when seated.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Lover

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chair! If you are heavy in weight be prepared as the Terralite is low to the ground. The trick is to get your feet as far under your body as possible, then go from sitting to standing in a straight vertical motion. Tremendous Customer Service via Natalie. I had requested a cap that secures one of the cords. It had popped off, not to be found. Three days after i got my correct address to Wildhorn I received, to my suprise, not a cap but a brand new chair. This is a company that stand 100% behind their products. Rare indeed. Look no further campers and hikers! Thank you Natalie and Wildhorn. (Steve in Colorado)
customer_reviews.author: speradotti

customer_reviews.title: Small and mighty
customer_reviews.text: Let's start off by saying this chair looks small and fragile. I am 6 feet and weigh in excess of 270 pounds. I am fat enough my butt hurts sitting on the rocky ground. I recently started hiking with a pack on for exercise, and just did a five day hiking camping trip This chair was heaven to relax in while letting my ankles and feet stop swelling and throbbing.. It held my weight, the sand feet were great in mud or sand. I am glad I bought it. I am glad it is soo strong. I will bring it every time. I was surprised how small it folded up to as well.. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great, handy chair.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two WildHorn terralite portable chairs, green and blue (not shown), very happy with this purchase because of the portability and simple design, no frills. It is surprising solid with evenly distributed weight, just take advantage of the optional foot pads! Use the half-globe feet in sand or soft soil, and use the smaller feet on solid surfaces. The dimensions of the chair are great for my height, 6ft, sitting about a foot off of the ground which is great for lounging. It weighs roughly 2 pounds and collapes into about the size of about a 3-liter bottle. I leave them in the back of the car all of the time, and they're handy for every occasion. Overall very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for backpacking, bonfires, and around the house. I weigh 220 pounds and this chair is quite comfortable. I love that it also comes with the larger feet so you don't sink in loose ground. I would definitely recommend this chair for the price. Might not weigh as much as a Helinox but its good enough and better for the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, durable and comfortable for us full figured guys.
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 4 day bike trip and loved it. Supplier sent two emails when I ordered that were most helpful. Like the instructions said it is a little hard to assemble the first couple of times but has wore in nicely. Holds my 225# in great comfort. Took it on a bike trail in Nebraska, totally awesome to have a comfortable place to sit at every stop. Great for campfires, just the right height. Will keep in the trunk of my car for soccer games.
customer_reviews.author: Pop N Wood

customer_reviews.title: Happy Soccer Mom
customer_reviews.text: I have one of those cool jumbo umbrellas that sits really low to the ground and this chair works great for soccer games! It took a little time to figure out how to set it up but I finally got it. My first one did break (my dad He-Man-ed one of the feet off and it broke the cap that holds the bungee cord in place). The company sent me an entire new chair! Awesome! PS: I am not a delicate flower (read over 250 lb) and I am totally comfortable in this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Morris

customer_reviews.title: Sweet seat
customer_reviews.text: This chair is perfect for kayak camping! So much better to be off the ground, leaning back and stretching out after a long day. Sits a little taller than other brands so easier to get out of. Very sturdy. Love the two options for feet: smaller feet for hard surfaces or large rounded feet for sand. Larger feet snap right onto the smaller ones so you only need to keep track of the easier to see large ones. Pocket is perfect for hankie or cell phone. A great design!
customer_reviews.author: A Tundra Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very happy soccer mom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair because I love to camp but I don't have a lot of space to pack extra chairs. This chair is great. It fits into such a small bag, yet it comfortably fits an adult when put together. As a proud soccer mom I immediately put it in my car for all the soccer games. I now have room in my trunk again for groceries. Lol. If you are hesitant to spend the money I would say it is well worth your money,
customer_reviews.author: aly

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required
customer_reviews.text: just remember that the top goes on first and that the material can take some effort to get in the right place. use the fabric to help you to orient the chair. the largest canvas goes on top and the thinnest goes on the bottom. the sides are of equal thicknesses. carrying bag was a nice touch and there's a hidden pocket good for a cellphone or something.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton P Mongillo

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: These chairs have been very useful in that they barely take up any room and have been used all over the place! Fishing, the beach, outside functions, scenic lunches, theme parks... My 8 yo can’t really stretch the material to get it on the frame bc it takes some muscle but the tight fit is what makes it feel sturdy and reliable. Was able to hold a person who was just over 200lbs. Unfortunately we lost one of the foot covers at our first outing but it has the second pairs of feet for sand and such so we were able to just use those.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great camp chair at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great camp chair and comes with a compact travel bag. I purchased this for a motorcycle rally. Fits in my side pannier and sets up quickly and easily. It's also very strong and hold my 200 pounds without issue. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the back isn't as tall as I would like. If you want a taller version check out the "name brand" one but be warned, it's $150!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Small and light
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very light and compact and great for camping. Everything seems to be high quality. It is a little hard to get the seat fabric on the first time (you may need a second person) but gets easier after that. This chair does sit a little lower than a traditional folding chair, but we find it to be more comfortable. However, it is not quite as comfortable to sit 2 people on because of the angle. It is a little expensive or I would replace all my chairs with them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Upped our camp chair usage
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chairs. I got 3 of them in different colors for our family. The oversized feet that don't sink are what set these apart from all the other ultralight camping chair clones out there. I don't always carry them, particularly if I want to lighten the overall weight, but they work extremely well in soft ground and sand. The rest of the chair is very well made and confidence inducing. What I didn't realize was how much more I'm using these over our old, bulky camp chairs. They're so easy to just toss in a bag or the back of the car and have something to sit in wherever you go.
customer_reviews.author: jpronline

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight for sure but can't rate anything else because we couldn't get it assembled
customer_reviews.text: We returned them. When assembling, it was easy to get the cover over the long posts at the top, but whenever we managed to wrestle the cover over a short post at the bottom, the post would pull out of the pocket immediately when we tried to get the cover over the other short post. We agreed that the pockets are too shallow to hold the posts securely. So we can't rate the comfort or sturdiness. We were impressed by how lightweight they were and how small they were when in the carry case, and the one we tried to assemble did indeed collapse easily for placing back in the carry case.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: So little did I realize that it takes a lot of times setting these up for the fabric to loosen up and be easier to set up. When you first buy one it will be pretty hard to set up because the fabric is very tight. After its set up they feel very comfortable and they're lightweight so carrying even two of these around is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: The chair seemed fine, but one of the feet (small ones
customer_reviews.text: The chair seemed fine, but one of the feet (small ones, there are two sets included) was loose from the start and fell off the first time I used the chair--lost it in the dark at the outdoor concert I bought the chair for. Also, the legs have a bit more give in them than I would like so it does not feel that stable. The next day I saw similar chairs at Sam's club and bought one for my wife for about half the price ($25) of the Amazon deal of the day. Hers is smaller (in the bag) and more stable. Feel like it should have been higher quality for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Kanch

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable 3. Can fit two in my backpack Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Extremely portable 2. Comfortable 3. Can fit two in my backpack Cons: 1. The "feet" fall off easily 2. My wife won't use these chairs without me due to the complicated setup&breakdown and difficulty to stretch the seat material over the frame. Unless I'm with her she will use bulky uncomfortable chairs because they are easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good chair, hard to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is comfortable, light and works well. I particularly like the add-on feet which do wonders on soft and muddy surfaces. It also comes in a nice small bag. The one downside of this chair is that it can be hard to assemble. The cloth seating surface is stretched tightly over the aluminum frame and it can be difficult to put on the chair. As a result, it takes longer to build the chair then I would like. I would also suggest that it would not be good for the elderly or other people who might struggle to stretch the seat over the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jay L

customer_reviews.title: Big comfort in little package
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome and way cheaper than the big known brand (sold at Cabella's, for example). It is much more stable and comfortable than I expected. I'm 6 feet and 240. I bought this for carting around in my motorcycle trunk, and it will be perfect. It's about the size of a flute case or maybe pool cue case, if those references mean anything to you, and super light. I would definitely recommend it, and I'm going to buy another or two or three.
customer_reviews.author: Geek On A Beemer

customer_reviews.title: Can be difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: it is Difficult to set it up. You have to have strength to put in together. But one it is let it sit for at least a day. (I just gotten it set up(05/26/2018). so I'll let it stay like that till Wednesday night 05/30/2018). If you do it like me then you'll be able to get it set up easier and faster (I think).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but works
customer_reviews.text: I bought the blue and the olive. Blue is as shown on the website, nice and bright. However, Olive is NOT olive. It is most distinctively desert sand. If you plan to be deployed to the middle east, it will match your army gear very nicely. Otherwise chosse another color. The included feet works as advertised but it increases the weight of the product considerably.
customer_reviews.author: T Ham

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money! Will not sink in the sand or mud!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 ft 3 weigh 185 and this chair is very comfortable for me to to set in. Fits in my lazy Rider bag that I carry on my motorcycle. Also has velcro straps on each end if I need to lash it outside my bag. Customer service with this company is some of the best that I've ever experienced. Jana is great! Chair is easy to assemble just follow the instructions on the part of starting with the long poles first when you're putting the canvas on.
customer_reviews.author: mark vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Small, light weight, and easy to pack.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a chair that would fit easily in a backpack or beach bag. I also wanted it to be light weight so that I could bring it with me on hikes or easily travel with it on vacation. This chair delivered on all of those fronts. It is extremely light weight and small enough to fit in a carry-on easily with lots of room for other travel essentials. I recently used this during a 4th of July parade and was impressed by its easy to set up AND take-down.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on April 7. Today I used it second time and one of the cables broke. The whole thing is unusable. Amazon says that return window closed on may 9. Bummer. However, I contacted Amazon and explained that the chair broke after being used only twice. They kindly replaced it and I will give it another chance.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Bagirov

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Have Been Looking For
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of camp/backpacking chairs with mixed results. ALL of them sank into the ground below me, eventually tipping me precariously to one side or another. FINALLY HERE IS THE CHAIR I HAVE LOOKED HIGH AND LOW FOR. Not only does it fit me well (5' 8", 225 lbs), pack small, and set up quickly, but it will not sink into the ground! While the interchangeable feet may add a little extra weight to your pack, they are well worth the comfort they help provide. This chair will not disappoint you and is a huge value for the functionality and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mick P.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Happy with my purchase, a good value, and fairly easy to assemble. The tension makes it a bit difficult to get all the poles inserted into the chair back when 2 poles are already inserted as others have mentioned, but it was manageable. The attached case is nice since it also has velcro straps to hang off the back of the chair or I used it to hang off my backpack when carrying a bunch of other gear.
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Terralite Portable Camp Chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I weigh 260 pounds and had my doubts about the max weight claim. Easy to assemble, compact, light weight and holds my 260 without twisting, sagging, popping or stress. Excellent customer service as well.
customer_reviews.author: melstrom1000

customer_reviews.title: The “sand feet” work great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar type chair but this chair is rated for 300 lbs rather than 250 lbs. Even though I don’t need the extra support the design is stronger. I wanted a beach chair and the main reason that I bought the chair was due to the “slip on sand feet”. The chair is easily set up and the extra sand feet simply slip over the existing feet.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Wildly Wow Chairs
customer_reviews.text: It is super light. Comes in a little mesh case. The collapsible frame assembles easily. The canvas seat was difficult to attach. I hooked the top ends on and then removed the lower poles from the frame hooked the canvas on and then stretched and pulled it down and slotted the pole back into the frame. Nice color. I sat in it and watched telly last night. very comfortable. The frame does move a little but it does not tip over. Going to use it for concerts in the park and picnics. I hope they are durable and last many years.
customer_reviews.author: gizmogal

customer_reviews.title: Broke the Very First Time I Used It
customer_reviews.text: I was on a walking trail on a very hot day and got overheated and was not hydrated as well as I could be, so took out my chair to sit. Sat there for 30 minutes and when I went to get up...VERY GENTLY and CAREFULLY the chair broke. I carried it for miles and then it broke and I had find a post office and send it home. VERY DISAPPOINTED DOESN'T EVEN COME CLOSE TO HOW I FEEL!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Roepke

customer_reviews.title: Please read this review before buying.
customer_reviews.text: REALLY difficult to put together (pressing the pieces into place). Men would have an easier time with it but most women could not do. My husband is very fit and strong and he struggles to press the pieces into place. Not worth the hassle so would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Sandtastic Seating
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I loved these chairs! We were flying to a sand volleyball tournament and wanted chairs for the beach. Most people I knew were buying chairs there and leaving them. I didn't want to waste money doing that! After reading the reviews I decided to give these a try. They did not disappoint. Very compact and light for being chairs! They practically put themselves together when you pull them out of the storage bag. You have to use a bit of muscle to attach seat portion to bars. It's not difficult, just a bit of force. Comfy enough for eight hours of watching tournament action in the sand!
customer_reviews.author: sonya jerome

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: I took this chair on two backpacking trips and used it four times each on those trips. I got back home and this weekend I was sitting at a sporting event and the pole went right through the support material and broke. I only weigh 220lbs..... This chair is comfy but doesn't hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: comfortable (5'09'' 170lb
customer_reviews.text: Replacing 2 larger (last version) camp chairs I carry. Saves room, comfortable (5'09'' 170lb, does not swallow me up, looks like it will last. Not that hard to assemble the first time, set up in garage stretching out right now, so I expect when I do want to set them up and use them, they should set up easy'r. Sit's lower than old chairs if you have bad back or knees this stile my not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Internal buggies came undone
customer_reviews.text: The chair is awesome....however it only lasted me one trip through the woods in the south when the bungee that connects all the tubing pulled lose and the chair fell apart. The whole purpose for a chair like this is to put it up and take it down quickly and repeatedly when out in the field. Until it decided to come apart I loved the chair... I dont know if they will replace it but if so I’ll definitely have to change my review when it comes to customer service... guess we’ll see. For now I’m a bit dissapointed
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a soccer game - Light and compact
customer_reviews.text: This chair is amazing! It was a little tight the first couple of times putting it together, but the size and weight make up for any effort needed to pull it together. It is light and compact, great for storing in the trunk. I thought it might be too short, which could make it difficult to get out of, but no such thing. I can easily stand up from the chair. My son also has one he is using while deployed, he loves the light, compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Corey B

customer_reviews.title: ... worth the extra money as it is built WAY better. More weight capacity
customer_reviews.text: I bought another brand that was cheaper but these are worth the extra money as it is built WAY better. More weight capacity, beefier aluminum and plastic components, bungee cords were stronger as well. It went together easier then my cheaper one with some flicks of the wrist instead of putting it together. The others work just fine, but I'm glad I bought these as well.
customer_reviews.author: Beta379

customer_reviews.title: Great chair! Without the sand feet
customer_reviews.text: Great chair! Without the sand feet, it’s a reasonable weight for backpacking. It’s well built, quick to assemble, and seems like it will last for many years. And of course the most important thing of all - it’s comfortable! It offers very stable support and the height is perfect for lounging. Update: the sand feet work great for beach days! No sinking! Great all around chair!
customer_reviews.author: kd78

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This chair is awesome, I have no complaints other than this is not as light as the Helinox at REI. But i am glad to have a heavier chair that wont sink in the mud UPDATE -- I've used this chair roughly 15 times, and now the fabric has frayed and the chair is coming apart. I am well below the weight limit, so I don't understand why this chair didn't make it a year... let's see how the company takes care of this...
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Moon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up - Update
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chair, but just after the return window closed, one of the end caps snapped when I was taking it apart. I can't find a way to replace the part and I no longer have a "contact seller" button. Update - Within hours of my review, the company contacted me and offered a refund or replacement. I took the replacement, because I really do love this chair! Small enough to leave in the car all the time, the big feet really do keep me from sinking in to the sand. Thanks for making it right.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Seems better than the previous 2 lightweight chairs that have disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: After intial concern that's it may be too heavy, all of that is a trade off for the sturdiness. It sits higher than my last backpacking chair. Very comfy and no concerns of safety. The extra feet may be Overkill but good to have in case soil is too soft.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad chair but I wouldn't say its really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad chair but I wouldn't say its really comfortable, but comfortable enough. I used it all day at the beach with the big beach pads. They seemed to work reasonably well. The chair is light and compact, does the job, just don't look for luxury comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke cap
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s light and portable and I can throw into a suitcase. However my brute husband was taking it apart and the cap end of a pole broke that holds the elastic rope and it came apart, he glued it back together. It was just disappointing to see how easily it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Simplify

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great chairs
customer_reviews.text: We have a family member weighing 350lbs who sat in this no problem. It’s amazing that these can hold that much. The chair is put up and down so easily and takes such little space. We decided to buy 3 more. We’ve used them camping and at the beach. The feet help keep you up on sand. Really glad we tried these.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: a pull tab would be a nice improvement. The costumer service was the best I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with 2 chairs breaking when I first tried assembling them. I believe it was probably my fault (may have assembled wrong). I contacted company by email and they responded within hours and shipped two new chairs no questions asked. New chairs working well. A little hard to pull fabric over last foot rod when assembling, a pull tab would be a nice improvement. The costumer service was the best I've ever experienced. They stand behind their product 100% and are fast to respond. Chairs are great. light weight compact and comfortable. we are packing them next week for a trip to St. Johns.
customer_reviews.author: tkd

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now used this chair on several 10+ mile over night back pack hikes. It’s light weight and attaches to my pack easily. Assembly / disassembly is quick and a breeze. The oversized feet are awesome when in the woods or on softer ground. Many other similar chairs have small feet and they sink into the ground as soon as you sit down I’m 6’3” and 230 lbs
customer_reviews.author: LSB

customer_reviews.title: I should have gotten my wife one also
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair so that I would have one on my motorcycle for camping trips or just going to the kids practices. I tried lugging around the full sized chairs but they are soo inconvenient. I take this chair everywhere I go. I am a hefty about 290 and this chair holds me just fine. My only complaint is that I should have got one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Serleio

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised of the quality of this chair for the price. The material, design and craftsmanship are equal to high dollar chairs. The bag and shoes/boots are a bonus. It's a little time consuming to put together, but worth the effort. The netting of the chair is very durable, but beware of mosquitoes taking advantage of the smorgasbord blood bank. If outdoors, spray the chair with bug spray first. All in all, it is an awesome chair.
customer_reviews.author: gregjowers

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a dozen uses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in February for trip to Death Valley and found the compact nature appealing. I’m 260 and happy to see the rating for 300#. For the price I would expect some solid use. This thing broke right through the corner connection just like the cheap $12 versions. I’ve used the chair once or twice over the last 5 months. Very disappointed to have this compact chair go down on me. I had such high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Clarior

customer_reviews.title: These are surprisingly perfect
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are amazing! Perfect for travel, super lightweight and actually quite comfortable. Would highly recommend for bike trips, back pack trips, keep in the trunk for kids games...perfect!!! I have to admit that when I first got them I thought there is no way these will hold up for a long time but am surprised how durable they are. They are a little tougher to get together the first time just because the fabric is so tight but after a few times using them it is a snap!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah T

customer_reviews.title: It breaks before you can put it together
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that snapped as soon as my first try, I love the original but the new ones are weak. As you can see I was in a car and didn't even get to try to pull it to the corner, it snapped as soon as a grabbed it and started to try. I was so disappointed. Maybe a bad run of plastic or poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love this chair
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love this chair. Price point was great; competitive to other chairs. Have used it less than a handful of times. I took it camping this weekend. When adjusting myself in the seat, the entire base snapped. I am 5' 10", 160 lbs. I have an REI Lite and have used it a lot more and put it through more use; and it is still going strong. If the item hadn't broke so easily, it would get 4-5 stars. After this weekend, I wanted to share my comments to make sure there was some text to the reviews I had seen that directly contributed to me purchasing this chair.
customer_reviews.author: John Michael Moos

customer_reviews.title: Storage bag broke
customer_reviews.text: The chair is decent to sit in. But some of the leg covers fall off easily. Also, I've only used the chair less than a dozen times and the zipper on the storage bag completely broke and fell off. So, now I have no way to store the chair and leg covers.
customer_reviews.author: dejagerw

customer_reviews.title: Never change the feet!
customer_reviews.text: This is a 2 year review and it was great until I stayed at a campsite with mud. I decided to change the feet on this chair to the larger ones and the chair literally tore itself apart. The elastic bands that hold the entire chair together are held in with plugs and when I took the feet off they all broke and now the chair is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Well made, conveniently breaks down for storing and carrying. However, it takes significant strength to stretch the seat cover over the frame--more than I have. The directions said some force might be needed and they really mean force. I've already given it away, it is too hard for me to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but...the first time I set it up and then took it down to pack away one of the clips at the end of the poles came loose and the elastic cord came out. Took a bit of time to fix it but got it back together eventually and I'm hopeful it will stay from now on. I am a little concerned that other clips may now pop out if I'm not careful. The chair takes a bit of strength to setup, but it is comfortable and serves the purpose for which I bought it. We'll see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Redbeard

customer_reviews.title: Packs small
customer_reviews.text: This chair packs small into it's own carrying bag. It is easy to assemble and is comfortable. The additional/optional large feet for the chair legs are excellent for keeping them from sinking into soft ground. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Earnest L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great chair!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome chair to take along with you anywhere you go where you might need. Lightweight, durable, and easy to use. Just watch that your string stretchy cords are tied tight. One of mine popped out, and it was a bit of a challenge to get it back in there and tied again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great travel chair
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what it says it is. I love that I can just put it in my bag or attach it to the side and take it anywhere. It is simple to use. The first time putting it together was not hard but did require a quick look at instructions to make sure it was right. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: It's a quality made chair. It's super light weight which is what I'm looking for camping or motorcycle trips. The only issues I have is that at 5'10" 185 pounds I have wider than average shoulders so the poles that support the upper back corners of the chair dig into your arms and back more than I expected. BUT besides that it's a good chair. I'll write a follow up review after a ling motorycle tour and rate it's longevity/ reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy comfy chair but not quick set-up
customer_reviews.text: It is a little cumbersome or awkward to assemble if you want to quickly unpack it or pack it to move locations. Once it is assembled, it’s a fine chair. It’s a perfect weight; it just didn’t unfold quickly. I used it at an archery tournament where I needed to pick it up and pack it and move quickly so it was not ideal. But once set up, it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia McCloud

customer_reviews.title: Best Chair I've found
customer_reviews.text: We recently went to the BWCA where weight is always a factor. This chair was lightweight and durable. Assembly is super-easy, the legs are shock-corded to the base. you just shake the base and all the legs pop into place, then put on the seat. much easier than other chairs I've had in the past. we compared this chair to the Heliox chair that we also took.... while the heliox chair was stupid-light, it did not feel as sturdy as this terralite chair, which was important since most of our group was 200-250 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality bag
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, while using this product for the first time, the bag that holds the chair pieces ripped while I was zipping it closed, the first time used...... . The quality of the bag is quite poor. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Stockdale

customer_reviews.title: The feet work in sand!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a trip to Kauai and they did exactly what we wanted them to do. They are light weight and were easy to pack in our luggage. The resort we were staying at would not allow lounge chairs on the beach so everyone was on the grass. When we found a nice shady spot in the sand, we pulled these suckers out and people would watch and stare in awe at this little bag that turned into a chair! And the feet work excellent in the sand! Very happy with the purchase and hope to bring them on our next adventure!
customer_reviews.author: Briana Derr

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Chair was generally all it was advertised to be, compact, lightweight and felt sturdy. However, after 9 months of mostly continuous use, the leather pocket used to hook the seat over the poles broke through. I am not a terribly large individual (approx. 165 lbs), and it was the material itself that ripped, not the stitching. I'm currently working through the warranty process, will update my review based on how it goes. Chair would have been 5 stars if it had help up longer.
customer_reviews.author: CK McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Light enough for check-in luggage.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and small size to put in check-in luggage. Durable. Solid enough for its purpose but I wouldn’t rock forth and back. Large rubber feet works better and I have used them on firm soil surface to watch games.
customer_reviews.author: Soccermom21

customer_reviews.title: but it is a great camp chair
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it on the beach yet, but it is a great camp chair! Putting the bigger feet on really does make it feel a lot more stable. materials and build quality seem really good, and it is super light! The bag is big enough that you don't have to cram it in there which is nice. It goes together really easy because of the spring loaded bars you just kindof have to shake it around and it puts itself together. I have no problem with it and I will probably get a couple more so i can have a full circle around the fire!
customer_reviews.author: justin lang

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality,  Inferior to similar chairs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought hoping it would be a less expensive substitute to a similar product from Helinox. I have had my Helinox chair for 4 years with no problems. This one was much harder to put together, and it broke on the second use. The sleeves that the aluminum rods go into are not reinforced enough and are too tight. This broke the plastic caps at the end of the rods, which hold the internal bungees. Amazon accepted the return.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: I like it. very compact
customer_reviews.text: I like it. very compact, easy to set-up, great base for sand/dirt so you don't sink, seems well made especially the fabric seat. carry bag is good. only issue is that it is so light that it could easily blow away. took fishing on open pier area and almost blew into the pacific ocean. I just wrap my reel/pole strap around the legs a little and that should prevent it from blowing away but wouldn't prevent it from blowing over
customer_reviews.author: GSY

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Chair to all needs and uses!
customer_reviews.text: I would have to say this is a great chair that can be used for any and all purposes. I keep my chair in the trunk of my car and I always have it ready to go at any time. It's compact, portable and does not take up much room. The design is unique and provides for a comfortable experience. Don't let the photos fool you. This chair is awesome! The Beach, Concerts, Soccer Games, Camp Fires. Etc. Great for all!
customer_reviews.author: WillDella86

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality are excellent. Very comfortable for motorcycle adventure touring on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Price and quality are excellent. Very comfortable for motorcycle adventure touring on my BMW dual sport cycle. The seat is just the perfect height allowing me to lounge under my rain tarp AND cook dinner. I weigh 195 pounds and the chair feels very stable. However, as they mentioned in the assembly instructions, it requires a little muscle strength and flexing of the tall back support tubes to get it into the pocket of the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Moonshadow751

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2.5 weekend trips
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. I have taken 3 weekend trips with this chair. This past weekend the chair had a complete failure. One of the leg joints the the metal poles snap in to broke in half dumping me on the ground. Just to be clear I have less then 12 hours of actual use in this chair. On top of that when the joint gave way the elastic bands that hold the legs together also broke. I'm a biggr guy but we'll under the weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

product_meta.title: Terralite Portable Camp Chair. Perfect for Camping, Beach, Backpacking & Outdoor Festivals. Compact & Heavy Duty (Supports 300 lbs). Includes TerraGrip Feet- Won’t Sink in The Sand or Mud.
feature_bullets: PORTABLE - Quit hauling huge bulky chairs around. At only 2.55 lbs (without Terragrip feet) and 3.2 pounds with the Terragrip feet installed the lightweight Terralite chair is perfect for any outdoor activity. Easily attach the chair to a backpack or bag with the built in strap for hands free transport.

WON'T SINK IN SAND OR MUD - With our exclusive Terragrip easy on / easy off feet the chair floats on the sand or mud making it perfect for the beach or other sandy / muddy conditions. Our innovative Terragrip feet can be installed in seconds so you can use your chair in any condition.

FREE FLEX TECHNOLOGY- Made from heavy duty aircraft grade 7075 aluminum the Terralite supports up to 300 lbs and is designed to flex with you as you move around while remaining completely stable. The seat cover is made from durable 600D nylon with breathable nylon mesh.

EASY SETUP & COMFORTABLE- Sets up in seconds so you can sink into the extra deep mesh fabric and enjoy that sunset on the beach, camp fire, kids sports events or music festival. Good things come in small packages!

MESH STORAGE BAG - Our mesh bag was designed so you don't have to be a magician to get it back in the bag. You can also clip the bag to the back of the chair so it doesn't get lost and have it double as a storage pouch.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
